availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer. Native of Ireland. Married to Permelia J. McLean Porter in Todd County, Kentucky, on May 1, 1826. Father of George W. Porter, Permelia A. Porter, Ephraim Porter, Jane S. Porter, Rubina E. Porter, Mary M. Porter, Barbara Porter, Virginia Porter, and Lucela L. Porter. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 159B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 733.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 617.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 95B (p. 8 of microfilm).
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Greenville, p. 9.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), Todd County, 1820-1886, Film # 000367186, p. 211 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Henry Porter (1800-1872)," Memorial #470603938, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70603938# (accessed December 6, 2018).
